text: i loved this game the music was fantastic for it so glad i kept my saturn instead of trading it in for a N64 when i was younger
author: Kakashi01

text: Very very nice, I loved this game! It was very colorful, and was a decent side scroller beat 'em up. I don't always feel nostalgic, but when I do, I grab a Sega Saturn controller.
author: Jason Hixon

text: I've heard of this, and frankly it looks really good. Normally I'd get the Saturn in a heartbeat cause it has many great games(some of the best ever). The problem occurs when you realize even the locally owned stores that sell the system and games realize just how freaking rare every one of the system's good games are. I'm talking $50 minimum, and can go well over $100, clear up to $400. Damit Saturn, why does everything about you have to be so damn rare? Just hit Virtual Console already!
author: Arc13

text: Astal... Glitter and Rage Issues.
author: Alex Arft

text: Ah, the Saturn, the console that almost could.

text:
Oh my god, I remember this gem of a game.

text: Oh God.. I remember Beating this game when i was younger, Never owned a Sega Saturn Myself But a friend did and had quite a decent collection, Was actually Quite a good plat former, kinda would like to play it again... author: Raiden29o9

text: Fantastic. If I had to unsubscribe from every channel but one, I'd probably keep this one. So many great tracks. I've never heard this one, but it's rather delightful.
author: Steven Lee

text: This was one of the games I got with my Saturn in '96.  So glad I kept the system and never sold any of the games for it.  I was blown away by the audio the Saturn could pump out even compared with it's competition (PS1, N64).
author: assgoblin2damax

text: Despite the Saturns Flaws some Developers still did some amazing stuff with this system up until the day it died. Astal is a Prime example of it, a beautiful game and Classic Saturn.
author: Scorchio

text: This wasï»¿ a fun platformer for the Saturn. It went under most people's radar though, which is unfortunate. It has great music and graphics. Saturn was the king of 2D graphics at the time. I really like this track, great mood and I love the electric guitar.
